result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Veronica Laura Lassiter

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Veronica Laura Lassiter appeared by video.  Attorney Robert N. Meyeroff appeared by video for Veronica Laura Lassiter.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State. Defense is further requesting a Motion Hearing date. Court advises that she only schedules motion hearings upon one being filed. Court calendars the next court date for a status conference date, and sets 11/17/2022 as the deadline to file any motions. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Veronica Laura Lassiter appeared by video.  Attorney Robert N. Meyeroff appeared by video for Veronica Laura Lassiter.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr for Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense received partial discovery and offer; defense requested adjournment. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM. Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Veronica Laura Lassiter in court, appear by video  with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff .  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Glendale Officer R. POETZL.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Veronica Laura Lassiter in court with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/22/22 @ 1p
